remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about XSD data types, see the "XML Data Types Reference" in the MSDN Library at [http://msdn.microsoft.com/library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library).
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the members in the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth> class to convert between a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth> object and an XSD `gMonth` string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth.Parse%2A> method is capable of parsing strings in various formats. The recognizable string formats are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |MM|The numeric month. Single-digit months have a leading zero.|11, 05| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, 08:00|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth.Parse%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth/CPP/demo.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapMonth/CS/demo.cs#11)]

Docs.exception: does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
